channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Cardboard and polystyrene dump, 17th June
item.description:
This is been dumped outside the property it has not been sorted into rubbish and recycling so the recycling truck did not take it today understandably. I dont know whoâ€™s it is and i dont feel comfortable touching other peoples rubbish to sort it for them. Please can this be properly disposed of? Im quite in shock at the amount of fly tipping in the area . Even with black top bin rubbish my bin is often full of other peoples rubbish with no space for my own.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 246,248, The Vista, Middle Park, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Over large Conker Tree, 17th June
item.description:
Tree on pavement very close to our house and branches overhanging our driveway. Tree branches also in danger of damaging high level telephone wire to our house. If tree should fall , at current size, it would do serious damage to our and immediate neighbours property.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Court Farm Road, Mottingham, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Rubbish and food waste left all over the pavement when garbage truck collected waste this morning, 17th June
item.description:
We all strive to keep our mews tidy and clean. This morning a veolia truck - not the normal lorry but a small electric vehicle - pulled up opposite. Took waste sacks from my neighbours bin and threw them into his truck scattering rubbish and food waste all over the street. He took my sacks and threw thise in and drove off leaving a disgusting mess behind.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 10, Wimpole Mews, Marylebone, Camden Town, City of Westminster
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: The barriers and 'water' bags that have been put in the lane at the entrance of the car park in Rectory Lane., 17th June
item.description:
The barriers and 'water' bags that have been put in the lane at the entrance of the car park in Rectory Lane - they have been put there since a leak was reported...resident would like to speak to someone about this as it is causing access issues and obstructing his entrance to his property...he said this has been ongoing for a month now.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Rectory Lane, North Cray, London
